title: 112_s2048
content: SECTION 1. TAX REPORTING FOR LIFE SETTLEMENT TRANSACTIONS. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to include a new section requiring returns for certain life insurance contract transactions. The new section in the Internal Revenue Code mandates reporting of details for life insurance contract transactions, including names, addresses, TINs, sale dates, issuer information, and payment amounts. Furnishing a written statement to individuals involved is also required. The new section in the Internal Revenue Code requires reporting of seller's basis in life insurance contracts, including seller's name, address, TIN, and investment in the contract. Issuers must make a return with this information upon receipt of the required statement or notice of transfer to a foreign person. The new section in the Internal Revenue Code mandates reporting of seller's basis in life insurance contracts, including seller's name, address, TIN, and investment in the contract. Issuers must provide a written statement to individuals with required information and make a return for reportable death benefits payments. The new section in the Internal Revenue Code requires reporting of reportable death benefits payments, including payer and recipient details, payment dates, and amounts. Issuers must also provide a written statement to recipients with necessary information. The new section in the Internal Revenue Code mandates reporting of reportable death benefits payments, with details on payers, recipients, payment dates, and amounts. Issuers are required to furnish recipients with a written statement containing essential information. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to include a new section mandating reporting of reportable death benefits payments. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to include a new section, 6050X, requiring reporting of certain life insurance contract transactions. Conforming amendments are made to section 6724. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to include a new section, 6050X, requiring reporting of certain life insurance contract transactions. Section 6047 is amended to exclude information required to be reported under section 6050X. The amendments apply to reportable policy sales and death benefits after December 31, 2012. SEC. 2 amends section 1016(a) of the Internal Revenue Code regarding the tax basis of life insurance contracts, specifying deductions for taxes, carrying charges, and expenses incurred under annuity or life insurance contracts. The effective date is after August 25, 2009. The amendment to section 101 of the Internal Revenue Code exempts commercial transfers of life insurance contracts from valuable consideration rules, specifically for reportable policy sales where the acquirer has no substantial relationship with the insured. The amendment to section 101 of the Internal Revenue Code, effective after December 31, 2012, includes a conforming amendment to paragraph (1) by adding paragraph (3). This amendment clarifies that the term 'indirectly' applies to acquiring an interest in a partnership, trust, or entity holding a life insurance contract.
